# Communication Matrix Template

## Purpose
Define clear communication expectations for project stakeholders to ensure consistent information flow and reduce miscommunication.

## Instructions
1. Copy this template to your project repository
2. Fill in stakeholder details for your specific project
3. Update as the project evolves or team members change
4. Review and update at project kickoff and major milestones

---

## Project Communication Matrix

| Role/Stakeholder | Primary Contact | Communication Channel | Cadence | Purpose |
|------------------|-----------------|----------------------|---------|---------|
| Project Manager | [Name] | Email, Slack #project-channel | Daily/As needed | Coordinate delivery, manage blockers, status updates |
| Product Manager | [Name] | Slack DM, Weekly sync meeting | Weekly + ad-hoc | Align on priorities, clarify requirements, trade-off decisions |
| Dev Lead / Tech Lead | [Name] | Slack #dev-channel, Standup | Daily standup, ad-hoc | Technical decisions, estimates, implementation questions |
| QA Lead | [Name] | Slack #qa-channel, Test plan reviews | Twice weekly + ad-hoc | Test coverage, quality gates, defect triage |
| UX Designer | [Name] | Design review meetings, Figma comments | Weekly review + ad-hoc | Design feedback, implementation clarifications |
| DevOps Engineer | [Name] | Slack #ops-channel | Weekly + pre-release | Deployment coordination, infrastructure needs, release planning |
| Data Analyst | [Name] | Email, Bi-weekly metrics review | Bi-weekly | Success metrics, instrumentation, post-launch analysis |
| Technical Writer | [Name] | Slack, Doc review meetings | Sprint-end + release | Documentation needs, release notes, user guides |
| Customer Support Lead | [Name] | Email, Slack #support-channel | Pre-release + post-launch | Feature training, known issues, support readiness |
| Executive Sponsor | [Name] | Email, Monthly status meeting | Monthly + escalations | Strategic alignment, major decisions, budget/resource approvals |
| Key Stakeholder 1 | [Name] | Email, Stakeholder update meeting | Bi-weekly | Progress updates, dependency coordination |

---

## Example: Filled Communication Matrix

| Role/Stakeholder | Primary Contact | Communication Channel | Cadence | Purpose |
|------------------|-----------------|----------------------|---------|---------|
| Project Manager | Alex Chen | Slack #project-galaxy | Daily/As needed | Coordinate delivery, manage blockers, status updates |
| Product Manager | Jordan Lee | Slack DM, Weekly 1:1 | Every Tuesday 2pm | Align on priorities, clarify requirements, scope decisions |
| Dev Lead | Sam Patel | Slack #dev-galaxy, Standup | Daily 10am standup | Technical decisions, estimates, implementation blockers |
| QA Lead | Casey O'Brien | Slack #qa-galaxy | Tue/Thu test sync | Test coverage, bug triage, release readiness |
| UX Designer | Riley Kim | Figma, Design review | Every Friday 3pm | Design feedback, asset delivery, usability validation |
| DevOps Engineer | Morgan Taylor | Slack #ops-alerts | Weekly Mon 11am + pre-deploy | CI/CD pipeline, infrastructure, deployment windows |
| Data Analyst | Avery Wong | Email, Dashboard reviews | Bi-weekly Thu 1pm | Metrics definition, instrumentation, launch analysis |
| Technical Writer | Taylor Martinez | Slack DM, Doc reviews | Sprint-end + pre-release | Release notes, user docs, API documentation |
| Customer Support Lead | Jamie Foster | Slack #support-galaxy | 1 week before launch + D+1 | Feature training, support runbook, customer comms |
| Executive Sponsor | Dr. Chris Johnson | Email, Monthly review | First Mon of month | Strategic updates, budget approvals, escalations |

---

## Notes
- Adjust cadence based on project phase (e.g., daily during crunch, weekly during maintenance)
- Add project-specific channels, tools, or stakeholders as needed
- Consider timezone differences for distributed teams
- Update primary contacts when team members change
